nodes.description: A certain King who was hunting in a great forest and lost his way.
A Witch who offers to help the King find his way out of the forest in exchange for her daughter's hand in marriage.
The beautiful daughter of the Old Woman whom the King is asked to marry.
The King's first wife, with whom he had seven children.
The King's seven children, six boys and a girl, whom he loves dearly.
A Wise Woman who gives the King a ball of yarn to help him find a hidden path.
The ruler who wishes to marry the Queen and defends her against accusations.
The King’s wife, who is beautiful but cannot speak, and is falsely accused of being a man-eater.
The King's children who are transformed into swans by the Queen's magic.
The only child who remains with the King after her brothers are transformed.
A girl who seeks her brothers and is determined to find them.
Six brothers who have been transformed into Swans and are under a curse.
A hut in the forest where the girl finds her brothers.
Potential threats to the girl if they find her in the forest-hut.
A determined young woman who resolves to save her brothers, even at the cost of her life.
The maiden's siblings who have been transformed into swans.
Servants of the King who find and bring the maiden to him.
The setting where the maiden sits in a tree and where the King is hunting.
The King's mother who disapproves of the Queen and falsely accuses her.
The first child born to the Queen, who is taken away by the wicked mother.
The second child born to the Queen, who is also taken away by the wicked mother.
The third child born to the Queen, who is taken away by the wicked mother.
The main female character who is accused and later proves her innocence.
The Queen's brothers who are transformed into swans and are saved by her.

links.description: The King agrees to marry the Old Woman's daughter in exchange for guidance out of the forest.
The King marries the Daughter of the Old Woman.
The King was previously married to the First Wife.
The King is the father of the seven Children.
The Wise Woman provides the King with a magical ball of yarn to help him navigate.
The Queen is married to the King.
The Old Woman is the mother of the Daughter.
The Old Woman falsely accuses the Queen and takes her children.
The King is married to the Queen.
The King is the father of the children.
The Little Girl is one of the King's children who remains with him.
The King falls in love with the maiden due to her beauty.
The King commands the huntsmen to find and bring the maiden to him.
The Queen transforms her children into swans.
The wicked mother disapproves of the Queen and falsely accuses her of being a man-eater.
The Queen is the mother of the first child.
The Queen is the mother of the second child.
The Queen is the mother of the third child.
The Queen is the sister of her brothers whom she saves from enchantment.
The Little Girl is a sister to the other children who were transformed.
The girl is the sister of the six brothers.
The robbers pose a danger to the girl if they discover her presence in their shelter.
The maiden is determined to save her brothers who have been transformed into swans.
The huntsmen capture the maiden from the tree and bring her before the King.
The Queen is the sister of the six brothers who were transformed into swans.
